title: Royle Stillman
text:
Royle Eldon Stillman (born January 2, 1951) is an American former <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="baseball%20player">player</a> whose career lasted for 3 seasons (1975–1977).
Beginnings.
An <a href="outfielder">outfielder</a>, he appeared in 75 <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> <a href="games%20played">games</a>, and played all or part of three seasons (– ) for the <a href="Baltimore%20Orioles">Baltimore Orioles</a> and <a href="Chicago%20White%20Sox">Chicago White Sox</a>. Stillman threw and batted <a href="left-handed">left-handed</a>; he stood tall and weighed .
Draft.
Originally <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball%20Draft">drafted</a> out of <a href="Torrance%2C%20California">North Torrance High School</a> by the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Dodgers">Los Angeles Dodgers</a> in during the 22nd round, the native of <a href="Santa%20Monica%2C%20California">Santa Monica, California</a>, played in the Dodger <a href="farm%20system">farm system</a> for three years, rising to the <a href="Double-A%20%28baseball%29">Double-A</a> level. He was acquired along with <a href="Doyle%20Alexander">Doyle Alexander</a>, <a href="Bob%20O%27Brien">Bob O'Brien</a> and <a href="Sergio%20Robles">Sergio Robles</a> by the <a href="Baltimore%20Orioles">Baltimore Orioles</a> from the Dodgers for <a href="Frank%20Robinson">Frank Robinson</a> and <a href="Pete%20Richert">Pete Richert</a> at the <a href="Winter%20Meetings">Winter Meetings</a> on December 2, 1971.
Minor Leagues.
Stillman spent 3 more seasons in the <a href="minor%20league%20baseball">minors</a> — <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">batting</a> over .300 twice — before his recall to Baltimore in June 1975. In his debut on June 22, he <a href="pinch%20hitter">pinch hit</a> for <a href="Doug%20DeCinces">Doug DeCinces</a> and <a href="strikeout">struck out</a> against <a href="Luis%20Tiant">Luis Tiant</a> of the <a href="Boston%20Red%20Sox">Boston Red Sox</a>. He returned to the <a href="Triple-A%20%28baseball%29">Triple-A</a> <a href="Rochester%20Red%20Wings">Rochester Red Wings</a> until his September recall, and he collected six <a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">hits</a> in 13 <a href="at%20bats">at bats</a> during that late-season trial to finish with a .429 MLB batting average.
Late career.
Stillman made the Orioles' roster in but collected only two hits in 22 at-bats in part-time duty, largely as a pinch hitter, before returning to Rochester. Signed as a <a href="free%20agent">free agent</a> by the White Sox after the season, he spent all of with Chicago, getting into 56 games, making 137 <a href="plate%20appearance">plate appearance</a>s, and hitting his only three Major League <a href="home%20runs">home runs</a>. His 33 MLB hits also included seven <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a> and one <a href="triple%20%28baseball%29">triple</a>.
